messages.msgSnippet: Well, I ve posted the same message twice thinking that it might not have reached the list (you know, got lost in cyberspace) the first time.  But after posting
messages.messageBody:
Well, I've posted the same message twice thinking that it might not have reached the list (you know, got lost in cyberspace) the first time. But after posting it the second time and getting it back to my computer both times I must assume that you folks are ignoring my question or just simply can't give me any answers. I wasn't aware how your system works for issues and questions. Ok, I'll look elsewhere for my answers.
Betty in TN
Mother to 14 yo Josh


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] ???????
messages.msgSnippet: ... Betty, I suspect no one here is from TN. Usually when a very specific question is ignored, everyone assumes some more knowledgeble person will be along to
messages.messageBody:
on 4/29/02 11:09 AM, Betty Holder at ninnyridge03@... wrote:

> Well, I've posted the same message twice thinking that it might not have
> reached the list (you know, got lost in cyberspace) the first time. But after
> posting it the second time and getting it back to my computer both times I
> must assume that you folks are ignoring my question or just simply can't give
> me any answers. I wasn't aware how your system works for issues and
> questions. Ok, I'll look elsewhere for my answers.
> Betty in TN
> Mother to 14 yo Josh

Betty, I suspect no one here is from TN. Usually when a very specific
question is ignored, everyone assumes some more knowledgeble person will be
along to answer it.

You might try the message boards at Unschooling.com in the Across the
Continent folder.

You can also try the National Home Education Network (http://www.nhen.org)
website. They have listings of state and local support groups. Hopefully
your state group has a webpage or email list.

Joyce
